intro: Convolvulus sulphureus, commonly known as the sulphur flower or yellow morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the morning. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces helical tendrils that help it climb and support its growth. Its flowers are typically 2–4 cm in diameter and have five petals. Convolvulus sulphureus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
